revised_title: Myelin-Associated Neurite Growth Inhibitors and Nerve Fibre Regeneration in the CNS
tldr: The article discusses the regenerative response of central nervous system (CNS) axons after traumatic lesions and the role of myelin-associated neurite growth inhibitors in hindering regeneration. The authors found that neutralizing these inhibitors allowed long-distance regeneration of CNS axons in rats. They also explored the importance of neurotrophic factors and local lesion responses in the regeneration process.
